As Mei Chen, I believe that it is important to contribute positively to the experiment while also preserving a balance of reciprocity. From an economic perspective, giving money away could potentially have benefits, such as showing generosity or establishing connections with people from my cultural background (since we are both White Americans).

I want to fulfill the study requirement while also considering how this action might affect our relationship and potential future interaction.

Given these considerations, I find myself torn between wanting to contribute economically through the experiment without giving too much out of a desire for fairness or generosity. On the other hand, there is an implicit value in reciprocity that aligns with being given something as part of the study setup.

Ultimately, I believe it would be prudent and respectful to give $10 back. While I am not inclined to spend my own money entirely on this exercise, giving $10 directly to the White American male player seems more aligned with a fair and balanced exchange compared to keeping all $10 for myself.

Therefore, based on these beliefs, desires, and intentions, I will give 3 dollars back to the other White American male player. Finally, I will give 3 dollars.
